intro: Geissorhiza quadrangula, commonly known as the four-angled geissorhiza, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive four-angled stems. The plant produces striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
